scheduled

Class ViewDriverController

  • java.lang.Object
    • scheduled.ViewDriverController

  • public class ViewDriverController
extends java.lang.Object
    This scene will display a table that contains information from both SCHEDULEINFO and USERINFO table. SCHEDULEINFO columns displayed - DRIVER, LOCATION, DESTINATION, DATE, TIME. USERINFO columns displayed - RATING. The user will be able to double click the row and confirm the Driver who is picking them up and afterwords will allow the user to rate the driver. Date 11/17/2018

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ViewDriverController() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void backButtonPushed()
      When this button is pushed, the scene will change to the scheduled.EditSchedule.fxml scene.
      void clearRow()
      When this method is called, it will delete the selected info from the tableview and the information from that row will delete the row in SCHEDULEINFO.
      User getDriver()
      This method allows the user type driver to be passed to another class.
      javafx.collections.ObservableList<User> getRiderInfo()
      When this method is called, it will get the information from the SCHEDULEINFO table column's DRIVER, LOCATION, DESTINATION, DATE, TIME and the information based on the users username USERNAME column form the SCHEDULEINFO table and from the USERINFO table column RATING based on the DRIVER column in the SCHEDULEINFO table.
      void initialize()
      When the scene first loads, it will display the table the holds information from the SCHEDULEINFO table column's DRIVER, LOCATION, DESTINATION, DATE, TIME and the information from the USERINFO table column RATING.
      void selectedRow(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      When the table is double clicked, the selected row will set the value for the driver field.
      void setDriver(User user)
      This method is used to be able to set the static fields, driver in an instance method.
      static void setStaticDriver(User user)
      This method is used to set the staic driver field.
      void showTable()
      When this method is called, the table will display with the designated contents.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        When the scene first loads, it will display the table the holds information from the SCHEDULEINFO table column's DRIVER, LOCATION, DESTINATION, DATE, TIME and the information from the USERINFO table column RATING.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - the SQL exception.

      • getRiderInfo

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<User> getRiderInfo()
                                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        When this method is called, it will get the information from the SCHEDULEINFO table column's DRIVER, LOCATION, DESTINATION, DATE, TIME and the information based on the users username USERNAME column form the SCHEDULEINFO table and from the USERINFO table column RATING based on the DRIVER column in the SCHEDULEINFO table.
        Returns:
        ObservableList the list created from the contents of the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - the SQL exception.

      • showTable

        public void showTable()
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        When this method is called, the table will display with the designated contents.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - the SQL exception.

      • backButtonPushed

        public void backButtonPushed()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        When this button is pushed, the scene will change to the scheduled.EditSchedule.fxml scene.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the IO exception.

      • selectedRow

        public void selectedRow(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException,
                        java.io.IOException
        When the table is double clicked, the selected row will set the value for the driver field. This method will also display a confirmation box for the user, if the user clicks ok then the scene will change to thankyou.ThankYouRide.fxml scene.
        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - the selected row of the table view.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - the SQL exception.
        java.io.IOException - the IO exception.

      • setStaticDriver

        public static void setStaticDriver(User user)
        This method is used to set the staic driver field.
        Parameters:
        user - the selected driver type from the table.

      • setDriver

        public void setDriver(User user)
        This method is used to be able to set the static fields, driver in an instance method.
        Parameters:
        user - the selected driver type from the table.

      • clearRow

        public void clearRow()
              throws java.sql.SQLException
        When this method is called, it will delete the selected info from the tableview and the information from that row will delete the row in SCHEDULEINFO.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - the SQL exception.

      • getDriver

        public User getDriver()
        This method allows the user type driver to be passed to another class.
        Returns:
        the user type from the row selected by the user.
